creator: psychosos@gmx.at
text:
After downloading (twice, to be sure there hasn't been a corruption during the 
download) the file apache_1.3.29-win32-x86-src.exe from http://www.apache.
org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/ in Windows Explorer it appears with the default 
icon for executables. When trying to execute it a black command line window 
opens, telling me the error message
"Program too big to fit in memory"
though there's still plenty of (physical!) memory available.

To me it appears as if this file is corrupted. But I verified it both with the 
supplied .asc as well as with the md5 checksum. I also tried a download from a 
different mirror, without success.
Regards.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please retest the 1.3.31 package, released yesterday.

  Since we don't see other reports, you might want to grab the microsoft
  installer add-in from MS, and use the .msi package instead.

  I'm going to assume unless I see other comments that this is a side-effect
  of the built-in InstallShield Windows Edition .exe deployer, which won't
  change till we change or upgrade installer technologies again.
